snippet: As a potential year-end fiscal crisis nears, White House officials have begun to wonder whether Speaker John A. Boehner can garner enough Republican votes to push through a deficit-reduction plan.
abstract: White House officials are questioning whether House Speaker John A Boehner can deliver enough Republican votes to push through a deficit-reduction plan and avert fiscal crisis; some senior Republicans in Congress say they are growing wary of deal between Boehner and Pres Obama.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: As a potential year-end fiscal crisis nears, White House officials have begun to wonder whether Speaker John A. Boehner can garner enough Republican votes to push through a deficit-reduction plan.

headline.seo: Questions on Whether Boehner Could Sell a Deal to G.O.P.
headline.main: As Fiscal Talks Heat Up, Questions on Whether Boehner Can Get the Votes
headline.print_headline: As Fiscal Talks Heat Up, Questions on Whether Boehner Can Get the Votes
